title: Dock Icon type
description: Choose what information should be shown in the app's Dock icon, if any.
longDescription: Choose what information should be shown in the app's Dock icon, if any.

title: Update Frequency
description: How frequently Activity Monitor should update its data, in seconds.
longDescription: How frequently Activity Monitor should update its data, in seconds.

title: Show Main Window on Launch
description: Show the main window when launching Activity Monitor.
longDescription: Controls whether the main Activity Monitor window appears automatically upon application launch.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not show main window on launch.

title: Show All Processes
description: Show all processes in Activity Monitor by default.
longDescription: Configures Activity Monitor to display all processes rather than a specific category (e.g., My Processes) when opened.

title: Sort by CPU Usage
description: Sort Activity Monitor results by CPU usage by default.
longDescription: Sets the default sort column in Activity Monitor to CPU Usage, with results sorted in descending order.

title: Sort Direction for CPU Usage
description: Set sort direction for CPU usage in Activity Monitor.
longDescription: Sets the sort direction for the CPU Usage column in Activity Monitor. 0 typically means descending.

title: Keep folders on top
description: Keep folders on top when sorting on Desktop.
longDescription: Keep folders on top when sorting items on the Desktop by name.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not keep folders on top (default).

title: Show/Hide All Icons
description: Show or hide all icons on the desktop.
longDescription: Controls the visibility of all icons on the desktop.

title: Show External Disks
description: Show or hide external disks on the desktop.
longDescription: Controls the visibility of external hard drives on the desktop.

title: Show Hard Disks
description: Show or hide internal hard disks on the desktop.
longDescription: Controls the visibility of internal hard drives on the desktop.

title: Show Connected Servers
description: Show or hide connected servers on the desktop.
longDescription: Controls the visibility of mounted network servers on the desktop.

title: Show Removable Media
description: Show or hide removable media (CDs, DVDs, iPods) on the desktop.
longDescription: Controls the visibility of removable media like CDs, DVDs, and iPods on the desktop.

title: Autohide Delay
description: Change the Dock opening delay when autohide is enabled.
longDescription: Adjusts the delay in seconds before the Dock appears when the mouse cursor approaches its edge, applicable when autohide is enabled. Requires `com.apple.dock.autohide` to be true.

title: Autohide Animation Time
description: Change the Dock opening and closing animation times.
longDescription: Modifies the duration of the Dock's show and hide animations when autohide is enabled. A value of 0 removes the animation. Requires `com.apple.dock.autohide` to be true.

title: Autohide
description: Autohides the Dock. Toggle with ‚å• alt+‚åò cmd+d.
longDescription: Controls whether the Dock automatically hides when the mouse cursor moves away and reappears when the cursor approaches its edge. This can also be toggled with the keyboard shortcut Option+Command+D.

title: Minimize Animation Effect
description: Change the Dock minimize animation effect.
longDescription: Sets the visual effect used when minimizing a window to the Dock. Requires `com.apple.dock.autohide` to be true to observe some effects properly.

title: Position
description: Set the Dock's position on the screen.
longDescription: Determines where the Dock is located on the screen.

title: Scroll to Expos√© App
description: Scroll up on a Dock icon to show all Space's opened windows for an app, or open stack.
longDescription: Enables or disables the ability to scroll up on an application's Dock icon to trigger App Expos√© (showing all open windows for that app) or to open a stack.

title: Show Recents
description: Show recently used apps in a separate section of the Dock.
longDescription: Controls whether a section for recently used applications is displayed in the Dock.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Display recent apps in the Dock (default).
Do not display recent apps in the Dock.

title: Active Applications Only
description: Only show opened apps in Dock.
longDescription: Configures the Dock to only display currently running applications. Pinned applications that are not open will not be shown. Warning: this command might empty your Dock of pinned, non-running apps.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Show apps pinned to the Dock (default).

notes: Beware this command empties your Dock of non-running pinned applications.

title: Icon Size
description: Set the icon size of Dock items in pixels.
longDescription: Adjusts the size of application icons displayed in the Dock, measured in pixels.

title: Highlight Hover Effect for Stacks
description: Enable highlight hover effect for the grid view of a stack in the Dock.
longDescription: When a stack in the Dock is opened in grid view, this setting enables a highlight effect when hovering over items.

title: Minimize Windows to Application Icon
description: Minimize windows into their application‚Äôs icon in the Dock.
longDescription: When enabled, minimizing a window will cause it to go into its application's icon in the Dock, rather than creating a separate minimized window tile.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Minimize to a new tile in Dock.

title: Spring Loading for Dock Items
description: Enable spring loading for all Dock items.
longDescription: Allows items to be 'spring-loaded' when dragged over Dock icons, meaning the application or stack might open or activate. Drag a file over an icon in the Dock, hover, and the application will open. The behaviour is unchanged if the app is already open. This behaviour has been observed with Preview, Quicktime, and iWork (Keynote, Pages, Numbers).

title: Show Indicator Lights
description: Show indicator lights for open applications in the Dock.
longDescription: Displays a small dot or indicator beneath the icons of applications that are currently running.

title: Wipe All App Icons
description: Wipe all (default) app icons from the Dock.
longDescription: Removes all application icons from the Dock. This is generally only useful for initial Mac setups or for users who do not use the Dock to launch applications.
notes: This action will clear your Dock of pinned applications.

title: Disable Launch Animation
description: Don‚Äôt animate opening applications from the Dock.
longDescription: Disables the bouncing animation that occurs when an application is launched from the Dock.

title: Show Hidden App Icons as Translucent
description: Make Dock icons of hidden applications translucent.
longDescription: When an application is hidden (e.g., via Command-H), its Dock icon will appear translucent.

title: Disable Launchpad Gesture
description: Disable the Launchpad gesture (pinch with thumb and three fingers).
longDescription: Turns off the trackpad gesture (typically a pinch with thumb and three fingers) that opens Launchpad.

title: Reset Launchpad
description: Reset Launchpad layout to default.
longDescription: Resets the Launchpad icon arrangement to its default state. This keeps the desktop wallpaper intact.

title: Autogather Large Files
description: Choose whether to autogather large files when submitting a feedback report.
longDescription: Determines if Feedback Assistant automatically gathers large diagnostic files when a report is submitted. Disabling this can prevent system slowdowns and reduce upload data, but may result in less complete diagnostic information for Apple.

title: Keep Folders On Top
description: Keep folders on top when sorting by name in Finder windows.
longDescription: When sorting items by name within a Finder window, this setting ensures that folders are listed before files.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not keep folders on top (default).

title: Show All File Extensions
description: Show all file extensions in the Finder.
longDescription: Makes Finder display the extensions for all files (e.g., .txt, .jpg, .app).

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not show all file extensions (default).

title: Show Hidden Files
description: Show hidden files in the Finder. Toggle with ‚åò cmd+‚áß shift+.
longDescription: Allows Finder to display files and folders that are normally hidden (those starting with a dot or flagged as hidden). This can also be toggled using the keyboard shortcut Command+Shift+Period (.).

title: Open Folders Destination
description: Set whether folders open in a new tab or a new window.
longDescription: Set whether folders shown in the Finder open in a new tab or a new window when using ‚åò cmd+double-click, and which option is shown in the context menu.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Open folders in a new tab (default).
Open folders in a new window.

title: Default Search Scope
description: Set the default search scope when performing a search in Finder.
longDescription: Configures where Finder starts searching by default: the current folder, the entire Mac, or the previously used scope.

title: Changing File Extension Warning
description: Choose whether to display a warning when changing a file extension.
longDescription: Controls if Finder shows a confirmation dialog when a file's extension is changed, warning that it might alter how the file opens.

title: Default View Style
description: Set the default view style for folders without custom setting.
longDescription: Determines the default view (Icon, List, Column, or Gallery) for Finder windows that do not have a specific view style saved.

title: Empty Bin Items After 30 Days
description: Remove items in the bin after 30 days automatically.
longDescription: If enabled, items moved to the Bin (Trash) will be automatically deleted after 30 days.

title: Default Save Location
description: Choose whether the default file save location is on disk or iCloud.
longDescription: Determines if the default save location in file dialogs is iCloud Drive or the local disk (typically the home directory).
notes: Changes may require restarting applications to take effect.

title: Sidebar Icon Size
description: Choose the size of Finder sidebar icons.
longDescription: Adjusts the size of icons displayed in the Finder sidebar.

title: Toolbar Title Rollover Delay
description: Choose the delay of the auto-hidden document-proxy icon.
longDescription: Sets the delay (in seconds) before the document proxy icon (folder icon next to the window title) appears when hovering over the title bar. Requires `com.apple.universalaccess.showWindowTitlebarIcons` to be false (default).

title: Quit Finder Menu Item
description: Add a quit option to the Finder menu.
longDescription: Adds a 'Quit Finder' (Command-Q) option to the Finder menu. Using this can lead to unexpected behavior as Finder is a core part of macOS.
notes: Behaves strangely when activated, use with caution.

title: Show Path Bar
description: Show path bar at the bottom of Finder windows.
longDescription: Displays a bar at the bottom of Finder windows showing the file path of the current location.

title: Show Window Title Bar Icons
description: Always show folder icon before title in the title bar.
longDescription: Forces the display of the folder/document proxy icon in the window title bar, even if not hovered. Requires Full Disk Access for the terminal.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Show icon in the title bar.
Hide icon from the title bar (default).

notes: This command requires granting full disk access to the terminal (System Settings ‚Üí Privacy & Security ‚Üí Full Disk Access).

title: Disable Window Animations
description: Disable Finder window animations and Get Info animations.
longDescription: Turns off various animations within Finder, such as window opening/closing and Get Info panel transitions, potentially making interactions feel faster.

title: Show Status Bar
description: Show status bar in Finder windows.
longDescription: Displays the status bar at the bottom of Finder windows, showing information like item count and free disk space.

title: Show Full POSIX Path in Title
description: Display full POSIX path as Finder window title.
longDescription: Makes the Finder window title bar show the full POSIX path of the currently open folder instead of just the folder name.

title: Disable Warning Before Emptying Trash
description: Disable the warning before emptying the Trash.
longDescription: Prevents Finder from showing a confirmation dialog when you choose to empty the Trash.

title: Fn/üåê Key Usage
description: Choose what happens when you press the Fn or üåêÔ∏é key on the keyboard.
longDescription: Configures the action performed when the Fn (or Globe) key is pressed. A restart of your Mac is required to apply these changes.

title: Function Keys Behavior
description: Allows you to change the behavior of the function keys.
longDescription: Allows you to change the behavior of the function keys (F1, F2, etc.). Either use them as special keys (e.g., brightness, volume) or as standard function keys. A restart of your Mac is required to apply these changes.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Use F1, F2, etc. as special keys (default).
Use F1, F2, etc. as standard function keys (press Fn for special features).

title: Keyboard Navigation
description: Choose whether to enable moving focus with Tab and Shift Tab.
longDescription: Enables or disables using the Tab key (and Shift-Tab) to navigate between all UI controls in windows and dialogs, not just text boxes and lists.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Disabled (default - Tab moves focus between text boxes and lists only).
Enabled (Tab moves focus between all controls).
Enabled (same as 2, used by some scripts).

notes: Changes may require restarting applications to take full effect.

title: Key Held Down Behavior (Press and Hold)
description: Allows you to select the behavior when a key is held down for a long time.
longDescription: Determines whether holding down a key shows the character accents menu or repeats the key. Restarting the Mac, logging out, or restarting applications is necessary for changes to take effect.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Repeat character while key is held.

title: Toggle Language Indicator
description: Toggle the language indicator visibility while switching input sources.
longDescription: Turns on or off the visual indicator that appears on screen when switching between different keyboard input sources (languages). Requires at least two input sources to be set up.
notes: User must have at least 2 Input Sources set up in Keyboard settings.

title: Key Repeat Rate
description: Set the keyboard key repeat rate.
longDescription: Adjusts how quickly a character repeats when a key is held down. Lower values mean faster repeat. Requires `ApplePressAndHoldEnabled` to be `false`.
notes: A value of 1 is very fast. Default is typically 2.

title: Initial Key Repeat Delay
description: Set the delay before key repeat begins.
longDescription: Adjusts the delay (in milliseconds) before a character starts repeating when a key is held down. Lower values mean a shorter delay. Requires `ApplePressAndHoldEnabled` to be `false`.
notes: A value of 10 is very short. Default is typically 15.

title: Digital Clock Format
description: This setting configures the time and date format for the Menu Bar digital clock.
longDescription: Customizes the format of the date and time displayed in the menu bar. Accepted values are combinations of date/time format specifiers (e.g., `EEE` for day of week, `HH` for 24-hour, `mm` for minutes, `ss` for seconds). The exact available specifiers may depend on Language & Region settings. Example format: `"EEE d MMM HH:mm:ss"`.

title: Flash Clock Time Separators
description: When enabled, the clock indicator (colon by default) will flash on and off each second.
longDescription: Makes the time separators (usually colons) in the menu bar clock flash every second.

title: Show Subject Field
description: Show the subject field in Messages.
longDescription: Shows or hides the subject field which appears above the iMessage/Text Message field. Text entered in the subject field will be sent in bold (unless there is no text in the main message field, then it's sent normally).

title: Toggle Apple Intelligence
description: Toggle Apple Intelligence from command line interface.
longDescription: Starting from macOS 15.3, Apple Intelligence is activated by default on ARM Macs. This setting allows deactivating or reactivating it. A restart may be needed.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Activate Apple Intelligence (default on compatible systems).

title: Help Menu Position (DevMode)
description: Choose whether the Help Menu should be always-on-top.
longDescription: Sets the behavior of the Help Viewer window. When DevMode is true, the Help Viewer window can go behind other windows. Otherwise, it stays on top.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Help Menu can go behind other windows.

title: Spring Loading for All Dock Items
description: Enable spring loading behavior for all items in the Dock.
longDescription: When a file is dragged over an application icon in the Dock and held, the application will open or activate, allowing the file to be dropped into it. This behavior applies to all Dock items, including those not typically supporting spring-loading. This functionality is the same as `com.apple.dock.enable-spring-load-actions-on-all-items`.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable spring loading for all Dock items.
Disable spring loading for all Dock items (default).

title: Application Downloaded from Internet Warning (Quarantine)
description: Turn off the ‚ÄúApplication Downloaded from Internet‚Äù quarantine warning.
longDescription: Disables the system dialog that appears when first opening an application downloaded from the internet. This may have security implications.
notes: Stopped working reliably on macOS Big Sur and later for GUI applications due to Gatekeeper changes. Primarily affects command-line initiated opens or older apps.

title: Confirm Changes on Close
description: Should you be asked to keep changes when closing documents or just have changes saved automatically.
longDescription: Controls whether applications prompt to save changes when closing a document with unsaved modifications. When true (default), changes are often auto-saved or resume is used. When false, a classic 'Save/Don't Save/Cancel' dialog appears. Requires app restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Prompt to save changes when closing documents.

title: Keep Windows When Quitting an Application (Resume)
description: When enabled, open documents and windows will be restored when you re-open an application.
longDescription: Controls the system-wide Resume feature. If true (default), applications will attempt to restore their open windows and documents when next launched. If false, applications will start with a clean state. Restarting the Mac or logging out is necessary for changes to take effect.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Keep windows when quitting an application (default).
Close windows when quitting an application.

title: Show Music Song Notifications
description: Display a notification when a new song starts in the Music app.
longDescription: Controls whether the Music app shows a system notification each time a new song begins playing.

title: Switch to Space with Open Windows
description: When switching to an app, switch to a space with open windows for this app.
longDescription: If an application has windows open in a different Space, switching to that application will also switch to the Space containing its windows.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Switch to a Space with open windows for the application (default).
Do not switch to a Space with open windows for the application.

title: Group Windows by Application
description: In Mission Control, group windows by application.
longDescription: When Mission Control is activated, windows from the same application will be grouped together.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not group windows by application (default, old Expos√© behavior).

title: Rearrange Spaces Automatically
description: Choose whether to rearrange Spaces automatically based on most recent use.
longDescription: If enabled, macOS will automatically reorder your virtual desktops (Spaces) based on which ones you've used most recently. If disabled, Spaces maintain a fixed order.

title: Displays Have Separate Spaces
description: Set up separate spaces for each display.
longDescription: When using multiple displays, this setting determines if each display can have its own set of Spaces (true, default), or if Spaces span across all displays (false). Requires a logout to take effect.

title: Focus Follows Mouse (Terminal)
description: Focus Terminal windows when the mouse cursor hovers over them.
longDescription: When enabled, moving the mouse cursor over a Terminal window will automatically bring focus to it, without needing a click. This focus change typically only works between Terminal windows.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Focus follows mouse for Terminal windows.

title: Pointer Acceleration
description: Enable or disable mouse pointer acceleration.
longDescription: Controls mouse pointer acceleration. When enabled (default, value false for `com.apple.mouse.linear`), the cursor moves further when the mouse is moved quickly. When disabled (value true for `com.apple.mouse.linear`), the cursor movement is directly proportional to mouse movement (linear). A restart of your Mac is required to apply these changes. This setting was introduced in macOS 14 Sonoma.
notes: This setting was introduced in macOS 14 Sonoma.

title: Tracking Speed (Scaling)
description: Set movement speed (scaling factor) of the mouse cursor.
longDescription: Adjusts the tracking speed of the mouse cursor. This is a float value where higher numbers mean faster movement. The System Settings UI maps specific float values to its slider. A restart of your Mac is required to apply these changes.
notes: Default value is 1.0. The UI slider typically ranges from 0.0 to 3.0.

title: Show Full URL
description: Show full website address in Safari's Smart Search Field.
longDescription: When enabled, Safari's address bar (Smart Search Field) will display the complete URL of the current webpage, including the scheme (http/https) and full path. When disabled (default), it often shows only the domain name.

title: Disable Shadow
description: Disable screenshot shadow when capturing a window.
longDescription: When taking a screenshot of a specific window (‚åò cmd+‚áß shift+4, then space, then click window), this setting controls whether a drop shadow is added to the resulting image.

title: Include Date in Filename
description: Include date and time in screenshot filenames.
longDescription: Determines if the filename of saved screenshots includes the date and time of capture.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Include date and time (e.g., Screenshot 2023-01-01 at 12.00.00.png) (default).
Do not include date and time (e.g., Screenshot.png, Screenshot 1.png).

title: Save Location
description: Set default screenshot save location.
longDescription: Specifies the directory where screenshots are saved by default.

title: Display Floating Thumbnail
description: Choose whether to display a floating thumbnail after taking a screenshot.
longDescription: Controls if a small floating thumbnail preview of the screenshot appears in the corner of the screen immediately after capture.

title: Image Format
description: Choose the screenshots image format.
longDescription: Sets the default file format for saved screenshots.

title: Screenshot Save Location
description: Set default location for Simulator screenshots.
longDescription: Specifies the directory where screenshots taken within the iOS/tvOS/watchOS Simulator application are saved. The specified folder must exist.
notes: The folder specified must exist in the filesystem.

title: Default Document Format (Rich Text)
description: Set default document format as rich text (.rtf) or plain text (.txt).
longDescription: Determines whether new documents created in TextEdit default to Rich Text Format (RTF) or Plain Text (.txt).

title: Smart Quotes
description: Set if quotation marks should be converted from neutral form to opening/closing variants.
longDescription: Controls whether TextEdit automatically converts straight quotation marks (`"` and `'`) into typographically correct curly opening and closing quotation marks (e.g., ‚Äú ‚Äù and ‚Äò ‚Äô).

title: Don't Offer New Disks for Backup
description: Prevent Time Machine from prompting to use newly connected storage as backup volumes.
longDescription: When a new external disk is connected, this setting controls whether Time Machine shows a prompt asking if you want to use it as a backup volume.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not prompt for new disks.
Prompt to use new disks for backup (default).

title: Dragging (without Drag Lock)
description: Enable dragging without drag lock.
longDescription: Enables a dragging mode where you double-tap an item and then drag it without needing to keep your finger pressed down. The drag ends when you lift your finger. This is mutually exclusive with Drag Lock and Three Finger Drag.
notes: Mutually exclusive with `DragLock` and `TrackpadThreeFingerDrag`.

title: Dragging with Drag Lock
description: Enable dragging with drag lock.
longDescription: Enables a dragging mode where you double-tap an item and then drag; the item remains 'locked' to the cursor until you tap again. This is mutually exclusive with Dragging (without lock) and Three Finger Drag.
notes: Mutually exclusive with `Dragging` and `TrackpadThreeFingerDrag`.

title: Click Weight (Threshold)
description: Choose trackpad click pressure between Light, Medium, or Firm.
longDescription: Adjusts the amount of pressure required for the trackpad to register a click.

title: Three Finger Drag
description: Enable dragging with three fingers.
longDescription: Allows you to drag items by placing three fingers on the trackpad and moving them. This is mutually exclusive with standard Dragging and Drag Lock.
notes: Mutually exclusive with `Dragging` and `DragLock`.

title: Add Additional Counterpart Suffixes
description: Add additional counterpart suffixes that Xcode should consider in the "Related Items > Counterparts" menu.
longDescription: Allows customization of Xcode's 'Counterparts' feature (Navigate > Jump to Counterpart or Ctrl+Cmd+Up/Down Arrow) by adding custom file suffixes for related files (e.g., for MVVM or VIPER architectures).
notes: Example to add ViewModel and View: `defaults write com.apple.dt.Xcode IDEAdditionalCounterpartSuffixes -array-add ViewModel View`

title: Show Build Durations
description: Show build durations in the Activity Viewer in Xcode's toolbar.
longDescription: Displays the time taken for each build operation in Xcode's toolbar (Activity Viewer area at the top of the workspace window).

title: Disable Boot Sound Effects
description: Disable the sound effects on boot.
longDescription: Mutes the startup chime when your Mac boots up.
notes: This command interacts with NVRAM: `sudo nvram SystemAudioVolume=" "` to set, `sudo nvram -d SystemAudioVolume` to delete.

title: Reduce Transparency
description: Disable transparency in the menu bar and elsewhere.
longDescription: Reduces transparency effects across macOS, such as in the menu bar and sidebars, which can improve readability and performance on older Macs.

title: Highlight Color
description: Set the system highlight color.
longDescription: Changes the color used for highlighting selected text and other UI elements. The value is a string of RGB components scaled from 0 to 1, space-separated.

title: Show Scroll Bars
description: Configure when scroll bars are visible.
longDescription: Determines the visibility of scroll bars in windows.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Show scroll bars only when scrolling.
Show scroll bars automatically based on input device (default).

title: Disable Focus Ring Animation
description: Disable the over-the-top focus ring animation.
longDescription: Turns off the animated effect for the focus ring that appears around UI elements when they gain keyboard focus.

title: Increase Window Resize Speed
description: Increase window resize speed for Cocoa applications.
longDescription: Speeds up the animation when resizing windows in Cocoa applications. A lower value means faster resizing.

title: Expand Save Panel by Default
description: Expand the save panel by default.
longDescription: Ensures that the save dialog (when saving a file) appears in its expanded view, showing options like file format and tags, rather than the compact view.
notes: Also set `NSNavPanelExpandedStateForSaveMode2` to `true` for broader compatibility.

title: Expand Print Panel by Default
description: Expand the print panel by default.
longDescription: Ensures that the print dialog appears in its expanded view, showing all printing options, rather than the compact view.
notes: Also set `PMPrintingExpandedStateForPrint2` to `true` for broader compatibility.

title: Automatically Quit Printer App
description: Automatically quit printer app once the print jobs complete.
longDescription: Configures the system to automatically close the printer application after all print jobs in its queue are finished.

title: Disable Automatic Termination of Inactive Apps
description: Disable automatic termination of inactive apps.
longDescription: Prevents macOS from automatically quitting applications that have been inactive for a period to save resources. Some users prefer to manage app lifecycle manually.

title: Disable Crash Reporter
description: Disable the crash reporter dialog.
longDescription: Prevents the crash reporter dialog from appearing when an application crashes.

title: Disable Automatic Capitalization
description: Disable automatic capitalization.
longDescription: Turns off the feature where the first letter of a sentence is automatically capitalized.

title: Disable Smart Dashes
description: Disable smart dashes.
longDescription: Prevents the automatic conversion of two hyphens (--) into an em dash (‚Äî) and a single hyphen between numbers into an en dash (‚Äì).

title: Disable Automatic Period Substitution
description: Disable automatic period substitution.
longDescription: Turns off the feature where typing two spaces automatically inserts a period followed by a space.

title: Disable Smart Quotes
description: Disable smart quotes.
longDescription: Prevents the automatic conversion of straight quotes (`"` and `'`) into curly (typographical) quotes (‚Äú ‚Äù and ‚Äò ‚Äô).

title: Disable Auto-correct
description: Disable automatic spelling correction.
longDescription: Turns off the system-wide automatic correction of misspelled words as you type.

title: Login Window Admin Host Info
description: Reveal IP address, hostname, OS version, etc. when clicking the clock in the login window.
longDescription: When set to `HostName`, clicking the clock in the login window will display system information like IP address, hostname, and OS version.

title: Trackpad Click Behavior
description: Enable tap to click for this user and for the login screen.
longDescription: Allows tapping on the trackpad to register as a click.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Disable tap to click (physical click required).

notes: Also consider setting `defaults -currentHost write NSGlobalDomain com.apple.mouse.tapBehavior -int 1` and `defaults write NSGlobalDomain com.apple.mouse.tapBehavior -int 1`.

title: Disable Force Click and Haptic Feedback
description: Disable Force Click and haptic feedback for trackpads that support it.
longDescription: Turns off the Force Click feature and the associated haptic feedback on compatible trackpads.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Disable Force Click and haptic feedback.
Enable Force Click and haptic feedback (default).

title: Tap Behavior (Current Host)
description: Enable tap to click for current user settings.
longDescription: Corresponds to the 'Tap to click' setting in System Settings for the current user.

title: Tap Behavior (Global)
description: Enable tap to click globally (e.g., for login screen).
longDescription: Sets the 'Tap to click' behavior system-wide, including the login screen.

title: Scroll Gesture Zoom
description: Use scroll gesture with the Ctrl (^) modifier key to zoom.
longDescription: Enables zooming the screen content by holding the Control key and using the scroll gesture (e.g., two-finger swipe on a trackpad).

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable scroll gesture zoom with Ctrl.
Disable scroll gesture zoom with Ctrl.

title: Zoom Modifier Key
description: Set the modifier key for scroll gesture zoom.
longDescription: Defines the modifier key used for scroll gesture zoom. 262144 corresponds to the Control (^) key.

title: Follow Keyboard Focus When Zoomed
description: Follow the keyboard focus while zoomed in.
longDescription: When screen zoom is active, this setting makes the zoomed area automatically follow the keyboard focus as you Tab through UI elements.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Zoom does not follow keyboard focus.

title: Require Password After Sleep/Screen Saver
description: Require password immediately after sleep or screen saver begins.
longDescription: Sets the system to require the user's password immediately after waking from sleep or when the screen saver activates.
notes: Also set `askForPasswordDelay` to 0.

title: Password Delay After Sleep/Screen Saver
description: Set delay before password is required after sleep or screen saver.
longDescription: Sets the delay (in seconds) before a password is required after sleep or screen saver begins. A value of 0 means immediately.

title: Enable Subpixel Font Rendering
description: Enable subpixel font rendering on non-Apple LCDs for sharper text.
longDescription: Adjusts font smoothing for LCD displays. A value of 1 typically enables light font smoothing with subpixel rendering, which can make text appear sharper on some non-Retina displays.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable light font smoothing (subpixel rendering for LCDs).

title: Enable HiDPI Display Modes
description: Enable HiDPI display modes (requires restart).
longDescription: Allows the selection of HiDPI (Retina-like) scaled resolutions on displays that might not offer them by default. Requires a restart to take effect.

title: Default New Window Location (Desktop)
description: Set Desktop as the default location for new Finder windows.
longDescription: Configures new Finder windows to open to the Desktop by default.
notes: Should be used with `NewWindowTargetPath` set to `file://${HOME}/Desktop/`.

title: Default New Window Path (Desktop)
description: Set the path for new Finder windows to Desktop.
longDescription: Specifies the exact path for new Finder windows when `NewWindowTarget` is set accordingly.

title: Enable Spring Loading for Directories
description: Enable spring loading for directories globally.
longDescription: When dragging an item over a folder, spring loading causes the folder to open automatically after a short delay, allowing you to drop the item into a subfolder.

title: Spring Loading Delay
description: Set the spring loading delay for directories.
longDescription: Adjusts the delay (in seconds) before a folder springs open when an item is dragged over it. A value of 0 means it opens almost instantly.

title: Avoid .DS_Store Files on Network Volumes
description: Avoid creating .DS_Store files on network volumes.
longDescription: Prevents Finder from creating .DS_Store files (which store custom attributes like icon positions) on network shares.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not write .DS_Store files on network volumes.

title: Avoid .DS_Store Files on USB Volumes
description: Avoid creating .DS_Store files on USB volumes.
longDescription: Prevents Finder from creating .DS_Store files on USB storage devices.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not write .DS_Store files on USB volumes.

title: Disable Disk Image Verification
description: Disable disk image verification for all types.
longDescription: Skips the verification process when mounting disk images (.dmg files). This can speed up mounting but bypasses a security check.
notes: Consider also setting `skip-verify-locked` and `skip-verify-remote` to true.

title: Automatically Open New Window for Mounted Read-Only Volumes
description: Automatically open a new Finder window when a read-only volume is mounted.
longDescription: When a read-only disk image or volume is mounted, Finder will automatically open a new window showing its contents.

title: Automatically Open New Window for Mounted Read-Write Volumes
description: Automatically open a new Finder window when a read-write volume is mounted.
longDescription: When a read-write disk image or volume is mounted, Finder will automatically open a new window showing its contents.

title: Automatically Open New Window for Removable Disks
description: Automatically open a new Finder window when a removable disk is connected.
longDescription: When a removable disk (like a USB drive) is connected, Finder will automatically open a new window showing its contents.

title: Enable AirDrop Over All Interfaces
description: Enable AirDrop over Ethernet and on unsupported Macs running Lion.
longDescription: Allows AirDrop to function over all network interfaces, including Ethernet, and potentially enables it on older Macs where it might be restricted.

title: Expand File Info Panes
description: Expand specific File Info panes by default.
longDescription: Configures the 'Get Info' window in Finder to have certain panes (General, Open With, Sharing & Permissions) expanded by default.
notes: Example: `defaults write com.apple.finder FXInfoPanesExpanded -dict General -bool true OpenWith -bool true Privileges -bool true`

title: Mission Control Animation Duration
description: Speed up Mission Control animations.
longDescription: Adjusts the duration of animations in Mission Control. A lower value (e.g., 0.1) makes animations faster.

title: Disable Dashboard
description: Disable Dashboard.
longDescription: Turns off the Dashboard feature, which provides quick access to widgets.
notes: Dashboard has been removed in macOS Catalina and later, so this setting is mostly relevant for older macOS versions.

title: Don't Show Dashboard as a Space
description: Don‚Äôt show Dashboard as a Space.
longDescription: Prevents Dashboard from appearing as a separate Space in Mission Control.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Dashboard as a Space (default on older systems).

notes: Relevant for macOS versions where Dashboard was a Space.

title: Hot Corner - Top Left
description: Configure the action for the top-left hot corner.
longDescription: Sets the action performed when the mouse cursor is moved to the top-left corner of the screen. See notes for possible values.
notes: Possible values: 0 (no-op), 2 (Mission Control), 3 (Application Windows), 4 (Desktop), 5 (Start Screen Saver), 6 (Disable Screen Saver), 7 (Dashboard), 10 (Put Display to Sleep), 11 (Launchpad), 12 (Notification Center), 13 (Lock Screen). Use with `wvous-tl-modifier` (0 for no modifier).

title: Hot Corner - Top Right
description: Configure the action for the top-right hot corner.
longDescription: Sets the action performed when the mouse cursor is moved to the top-right corner of the screen. See notes for possible values.
notes: Possible values: 0 (no-op), 2 (Mission Control), 3 (Application Windows), 4 (Desktop), 5 (Start Screen Saver), 6 (Disable Screen Saver), 7 (Dashboard), 10 (Put Display to Sleep), 11 (Launchpad), 12 (Notification Center), 13 (Lock Screen). Use with `wvous-tr-modifier` (0 for no modifier, 1048576 for Command).

title: Hot Corner - Bottom Left
description: Configure the action for the bottom-left hot corner.
longDescription: Sets the action performed when the mouse cursor is moved to the bottom-left corner of the screen. See notes for possible values.
notes: Possible values: 0 (no-op), 2 (Mission Control), 3 (Application Windows), 4 (Desktop), 5 (Start Screen Saver), 6 (Disable Screen Saver), 7 (Dashboard), 10 (Put Display to Sleep), 11 (Launchpad), 12 (Notification Center), 13 (Lock Screen). Use with `wvous-bl-modifier` (0 for no modifier).

title: Hot Corner - Bottom Right
description: Configure the action for the bottom-right hot corner.
longDescription: Sets the action performed when the mouse cursor is moved to the bottom-right corner of the screen. See notes for possible values.
notes: Possible values: 0 (no-op), 2 (Mission Control), 3 (Application Windows), 4 (Desktop), 5 (Start Screen Saver), 6 (Disable Screen Saver), 7 (Dashboard), 10 (Put Display to Sleep), 11 (Launchpad), 12 (Notification Center), 13 (Lock Screen). Use with `wvous-br-modifier` (1048576 for Command).

title: Disable Universal Search Suggestions
description: Privacy: don‚Äôt send search queries to Apple via Safari's universal search.
longDescription: Prevents Safari from sending search queries to Apple for suggestions in the Smart Search Field.
notes: Consider also setting `SuppressSearchSuggestions` to true.

title: Suppress Search Suggestions
description: Suppress search suggestions in Safari.
longDescription: Further limits search suggestions provided by Safari.

title: Enable Tab to Highlight Web Page Items
description: Press Tab to highlight each item on a web page.
longDescription: Allows using the Tab key to navigate through all interactive items (links, buttons, form fields) on a webpage, not just form fields.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Tab highlights text fields and lists only (default).

notes: Also set `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2TabsToLinks` to true.

title: Set Home Page
description: Set Safari‚Äôs home page.
longDescription: Configures the URL that Safari loads when the home button is clicked or when new windows/tabs are set to open with the home page.

title: Disable Auto-Open Safe Downloads
description: Prevent Safari from opening ‚Äòsafe‚Äô files automatically after downloading.
longDescription: Disables Safari's feature that automatically opens files considered 'safe' (like images, PDFs, text documents) after they finish downloading.

title: Enable Backspace for Back Navigation
description: Allow hitting the Backspace key to go to the previous page in history.
longDescription: Enables using the Backspace key as a shortcut to navigate to the previously visited page in Safari.

title: Hide Bookmarks Bar
description: Hide Safari‚Äôs bookmarks bar by default.
longDescription: Sets the default visibility of the bookmarks bar (Favorites Bar) in Safari to hidden.

title: Hide Sidebar in Top Sites
description: Hide Safari‚Äôs sidebar in Top Sites view.
longDescription: Prevents the sidebar (which might show Reading List or Bookmarks) from appearing when viewing Top Sites in Safari.

title: Disable Thumbnail Cache for History/Top Sites
description: Disable Safari‚Äôs thumbnail cache for History and Top Sites.
longDescription: Controls the update policy for website preview snapshots used in History and Top Sites. Setting to 2 disables this cache.

title: Enable Safari Debug Menu
description: Enable Safari‚Äôs internal debug menu.
longDescription: Adds a 'Debug' menu to Safari's menu bar, providing access to various internal settings and diagnostic tools.

title: Find on Page Default to 'Contains'
description: Make Safari‚Äôs search banners default to Contains instead of Starts With.
longDescription: Changes the default behavior of the 'Find on Page' feature (Command-F) to search for text that 'contains' the search term, rather than 'starts with' it.

title: Remove Icons from Bookmarks Bar
description: Remove useless icons from Safari‚Äôs bookmarks bar.
longDescription: Clears any predefined proxy icons or special items from Safari's bookmarks bar by setting it to an empty array.

title: Enable Develop Menu and Web Inspector
description: Enable the Develop menu and the Web Inspector in Safari.
longDescription: Adds the 'Develop' menu to Safari's menu bar, which provides access to web development tools like the Web Inspector.
notes: Also set `WebKitDeveloperExtrasEnabledPreferenceKey` and `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2DeveloperExtrasEnabled` to true for full effect, and `NSGlobalDomain WebKitDeveloperExtras -bool true` for context menu item.

title: Enable Continuous Spellchecking
description: Enable continuous spellchecking in Safari.
longDescription: Turns on Safari's feature to check spelling continuously as you type in web forms and text areas.

title: Disable Auto-correct in Safari
description: Disable auto-correct in Safari.
longDescription: Turns off Safari's automatic correction of misspelled words while typing in web content.

title: Disable AutoFill from Address Book
description: Disable AutoFill from Address Book in Safari.
longDescription: Prevents Safari from automatically filling web forms with contact information from your Address Book/Contacts.

title: Disable AutoFill Passwords
description: Disable AutoFill for passwords in Safari.
longDescription: Prevents Safari from automatically filling saved passwords into login forms.

title: Disable AutoFill Credit Card Data
description: Disable AutoFill for credit card data in Safari.
longDescription: Prevents Safari from automatically filling saved credit card information into web forms.

title: Disable AutoFill Miscellaneous Forms
description: Disable AutoFill for miscellaneous forms in Safari.
longDescription: Prevents Safari from automatically filling other types of form data not covered by contacts, passwords, or credit cards.

title: Warn About Fraudulent Websites
description: Warn about fraudulent websites in Safari.
longDescription: Enables Safari's built-in protection against phishing and other fraudulent websites by displaying a warning.

title: Disable Web Plugins
description: Disable web plugins in Safari.
longDescription: Turns off support for legacy web plugins (like Flash, Silverlight) in Safari. Modern web browsers largely deprecate these.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable web plugins (default on older systems).

notes: Also set `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2PluginsEnabled` to false.

title: Disable Java
description: Disable Java in Safari.
longDescription: Turns off support for the Java plugin in Safari. Java applets are largely obsolete and a security concern.
notes: Also set `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2JavaEnabled` and `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2JavaEnabledForLocalFiles` to false.

title: Block Pop-up Windows
description: Block pop-up windows in Safari.
longDescription: Controls whether Safari allows websites to open pop-up windows automatically via JavaScript.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Allow pop-ups (default on older systems, or if user allowed).

notes: Also set `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2JavaScriptCanOpenWindowsAutomatically` to false.

title: Disable Auto-playing Video (Inline)
description: Disable auto-playing video inline in Safari.
longDescription: Prevents videos from playing automatically when they are embedded inline on a webpage.
notes: Also consider `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2AllowsInlineMediaPlayback`.

title: Enable 'Do Not Track'
description: Enable ‚ÄúDo Not Track‚Äù HTTP header in Safari.
longDescription: Instructs Safari to send a 'Do Not Track' header with web requests, signaling to websites that the user prefers not to be tracked. Compliance by websites is voluntary.

title: Update Extensions Automatically
description: Update Safari extensions automatically.
longDescription: Configures Safari to automatically check for and install updates to installed extensions.

title: Default to Plain Text Mode
description: Use plain text mode for new TextEdit documents.
longDescription: Sets TextEdit to create new documents in plain text (.txt) format by default, instead of rich text (.rtf).

title: Default Plain Text Encoding (Read)
description: Open plain text files as UTF-8 in TextEdit.
longDescription: Sets the default character encoding TextEdit uses when opening plain text files to UTF-8.

title: Default Plain Text Encoding (Write)
description: Save plain text files as UTF-8 in TextEdit.
longDescription: Sets the default character encoding TextEdit uses when saving plain text files to UTF-8.

title: Trackpad Tracking Speed
description: Adjust the trackpad tracking speed.
longDescription: Sets the scaling factor for trackpad movement. Higher values result in faster cursor movement relative to finger movement on the trackpad.
notes: Default system values vary, 0.7 is a common customization for a slightly faster feel.

title: Enable Lid Wakeup
description: Enable the system to wake from sleep when the lid is opened.
longDescription: Ensures that the Mac wakes from sleep mode when the laptop lid is opened.
notes: Managed via `sudo pmset -a lidwake 1`.

title: Restart Automatically on Power Loss
description: Restart the system automatically after a power failure.
longDescription: Configures the Mac to automatically restart if it shuts down due to a power loss once power is restored.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable automatic restart on power loss.
Disable automatic restart on power loss.

notes: Managed via `sudo pmset -a autorestart 1`.

title: Restart Automatically on Freeze
description: Restart the system automatically if the computer freezes.
longDescription: Enables a feature where the system will attempt to restart itself if it detects a system freeze or hang.
notes: Managed via `sudo systemsetup -setrestartfreeze on`.

title: Display Sleep Timer
description: Set the display sleep timer in minutes.
longDescription: Configures how long the display remains on during inactivity before it sleeps. Applies to both battery and power adapter.
notes: Managed via `sudo pmset -a displaysleep 15` (for 15 minutes).

title: Disable Machine Sleep While Charging
description: Disable computer sleep when connected to a power adapter.
longDescription: Prevents the Mac from going into computer sleep mode when it's plugged into a power adapter.
notes: Managed via `sudo pmset -c sleep 0`.

title: Machine Sleep Timer (Battery)
description: Set the computer sleep timer in minutes when on battery power.
longDescription: Configures how long the Mac remains idle on battery power before it goes into computer sleep mode.
notes: Managed via `sudo pmset -b sleep 5` (for 5 minutes).

title: Standby Delay
description: Set the standby delay in seconds.
longDescription: Configures the delay before the Mac enters standby mode (a deeper sleep state) after normal sleep. 86400 seconds is 24 hours.
notes: Managed via `sudo pmset -a standbydelay 86400`.

title: Disable Computer Sleep Mode
description: Never go into computer sleep mode.
longDescription: Prevents the Mac from ever entering computer sleep mode automatically.
notes: Managed via `sudo systemsetup -setcomputersleep Off`.

title: Hibernation Mode
description: Set the hibernation mode.
longDescription: Configures how the Mac handles hibernation (saving RAM contents to disk before sleeping). Mode 0 disables hibernation, which can speed up entering sleep but risks data loss on power failure. Mode 3 (default for laptops) copies RAM to disk for state restoration.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Safe sleep (RAM to disk, RAM powered off - default for laptops).
Hibernate (RAM to disk, RAM powered off - default for desktops after 2005).

notes: Managed via `sudo pmset -a hibernatemode 0`. Changing this can affect sleep/wake behavior and battery life.

title: Disable Infrared Receiver
description: Disable the Apple Remote infrared receiver.
longDescription: Turns off the built-in infrared receiver, preventing Apple Remotes from controlling the Mac.

title: Disable AirDrop
description: Disable AirDrop functionality.
longDescription: Turns off AirDrop, preventing wireless sharing of files with nearby Apple devices.

title: Screen Saver Idle Time
description: Set screen saver idle timeout in seconds.
longDescription: Configures how long the Mac must be idle before the screen saver activates. Value is in seconds.
notes: 300 seconds = 5 minutes.

title: Destroy FileVault Key on Standby
description: Destroy FileVault key when going into standby mode for added security.
longDescription: When enabled, the FileVault encryption key is destroyed when the Mac enters standby (deep sleep), requiring a password on wake. This enhances security but may slightly increase wake time.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not destroy FileVault key on standby (default).

notes: Managed via `sudo pmset -a destroyfvkeyonstandby 1`.

title: Force Limit Ad Tracking
description: Enable Limit Ad Tracking.
longDescription: Attempts to globally limit ad tracking by applications and services on macOS.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Allow ad tracking (default behavior may vary).

title: Increase Bluetooth Audio Quality (Bitpool)
description: Increase sound quality for Bluetooth headphones/headsets by increasing the bitpool.
longDescription: Adjusts the minimum bitpool value for Bluetooth audio, which can potentially improve audio quality for headphones and headsets. Higher values may improve quality but could affect stability or range.
notes: Typical default is lower. 40-58 are common custom values.

title: Disable Spotlight Indexing for Mounted Volumes
description: Disable Spotlight indexing for any volume that gets mounted and has not yet been indexed.
longDescription: Prevents Spotlight from automatically indexing newly mounted volumes that it hasn't seen before. This adds `/Volumes` to the exclusion list.
notes: Command: `sudo defaults write /.Spotlight-V100/VolumeConfiguration Exclusions -array "/Volumes"`. Use `sudo mdutil -i off "/Volumes/foo"` for specific volumes.

title: Configure Spotlight Search Result Order and Items
description: Change indexing order and disable some search results in Spotlight.
longDescription: Customizes the order and visibility of different categories in Spotlight search results. Can disable categories like Documents, Messages, or web search suggestions.
notes: The value is an array of dictionaries, each specifying an item's name and whether it's enabled. Example to enable Applications and System Prefs but disable Documents: `defaults write com.apple.spotlight orderedItems -array '{"enabled" = 1;"name" = "APPLICATIONS";}' '{"enabled" = 1;"name" = "SYSTEM_PREFS";}' '{"enabled" = 0;"name" = "DOCUMENTS";}' ...`

title: Default String Encoding (UTF-8)
description: Only use UTF-8 in Terminal.app.
longDescription: Sets the default string encoding for Terminal.app to UTF-8 (value 4).
notes: Command: `defaults write com.apple.terminal StringEncodings -array 4`

title: Enable Secure Keyboard Entry
description: Enable Secure Keyboard Entry in Terminal.app.
longDescription: Prevents other applications from intercepting keystrokes entered into Terminal windows, enhancing security.

title: Disable Line Marks
description: Disable the annoying line marks in Terminal.app.
longDescription: Removes the visual marks or indicators that can appear at the beginning of lines in Terminal output.

title: Enable WebKit Developer Tools in App Store
description: Enable the WebKit Developer Tools in the Mac App Store.
longDescription: Adds Web Inspector and other developer tools, similar to Safari's Develop menu, to the Mac App Store application, useful for debugging its web content.

title: Enable Debug Menu in App Store
description: Enable Debug Menu in the Mac App Store.
longDescription: Adds a hidden 'Debug' menu to the Mac App Store application, providing access to internal options and diagnostics.

title: Enable Automatic Update Check
description: Enable the automatic check for software updates.
longDescription: Configures the system to automatically check for available macOS and app updates.

title: Software Update Check Frequency
description: Check for software updates daily, not just once per week.
longDescription: Sets the frequency for automatic software update checks. In days.

title: Download Updates in Background
description: Download newly available updates in the background.
longDescription: Allows the system to automatically download available software updates in the background without prompting.

title: Install System Data Files & Security Updates
description: Install System data files & security updates automatically.
longDescription: Enables the automatic installation of important system data files and security updates (like XProtect, Gatekeeper, MRT updates).

title: Automatically Download Apps Purchased on Other Macs
description: Automatically download apps purchased on other Macs associated with the same Apple ID.
longDescription: If enabled, apps purchased or downloaded on other Macs or iOS devices using the same Apple ID will be automatically downloaded to this Mac.

title: Turn On App Auto-Update
description: Turn on automatic updates for apps from the Mac App Store.
longDescription: Enables apps downloaded from the Mac App Store to be updated automatically in the background.

title: Allow App Store to Reboot for macOS Updates
description: Allow the App Store to reboot the machine if required for macOS updates.
longDescription: Grants permission for the system to automatically restart if a macOS update downloaded via the App Store requires it.

title: Prevent Photos Auto-Launch
description: Prevent Photos from opening automatically when devices are plugged in.
longDescription: Stops the Photos app from automatically launching when a camera, iPhone, or SD card is connected to the Mac.

title: Disable Automatic Emoji Substitution
description: Disable automatic emoji substitution (i.e. use plain text smileys).
longDescription: Prevents Messages from automatically converting text-based emoticons like `:)` into emoji characters.
notes: This key is a dictionary. To disable emoji substitution: `defaults write com.apple.messageshelper.MessageController SOInputLineSettings -dict-add "automaticEmojiSubstitutionEnablediMessage" -bool false`

title: Disable Smart Quotes in Messages
description: Disable smart quotes in Messages as it‚Äôs annoying for messages that contain code.
longDescription: Prevents Messages from automatically converting straight quotes to curly quotes, which is useful when sending code snippets.
notes: This key is a dictionary. To disable smart quotes: `defaults write com.apple.messageshelper.MessageController SOInputLineSettings -dict-add "automaticQuoteSubstitutionEnabled" -bool false`

title: Disable Continuous Spell Checking in Messages
description: Disable continuous spell checking in Messages.
longDescription: Turns off the automatic spell checking feature within the Messages app as you type.
notes: This key is a dictionary. To disable continuous spell checking: `defaults write com.apple.messageshelper.MessageController SOInputLineSettings -dict-add "continuousSpellCheckingEnabled" -bool false`

title: Disable Trackpad Back/Forward Swipe Navigation
description: Disable the swipe gesture for back/forward navigation on trackpads in Google Chrome.
longDescription: Prevents the two-finger swipe gesture on a trackpad from navigating back or forward in Chrome's browsing history.
notes: Apply similarly to `com.google.Chrome.canary` if using Canary.

title: Disable Mouse Back/Forward Swipe Navigation
description: Disable the swipe gesture for back/forward navigation with a Magic Mouse in Google Chrome.
longDescription: Prevents the swipe gesture on a Magic Mouse from navigating back or forward in Chrome's browsing history.
notes: Apply similarly to `com.google.Chrome.canary` if using Canary.

title: Use System Print Preview Dialog
description: Use the system-native print preview dialog in Google Chrome instead of Chrome's built-in one.
longDescription: Forces Google Chrome to use the standard macOS print dialog, bypassing Chrome's custom print preview interface.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Disable Chrome's print preview (use system dialog).

notes: Apply similarly to `com.google.Chrome.canary` if using Canary.

title: Expand Print Dialog by Default
description: Expand the system print dialog by default in Google Chrome.
longDescription: When using the system print dialog in Chrome, this ensures it opens in its expanded state, showing all options.
notes: Apply similarly to `com.google.Chrome.canary` if using Canary.

title: Use Incomplete Download Folder
description: Use a specific folder to store incomplete downloads.
longDescription: Tells Transmission to save partially downloaded files to a designated 'incomplete' folder.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not use incomplete download folder (default).

notes: Pair with `IncompleteDownloadFolder` key to specify the path.

title: Incomplete Download Folder Path
description: Set the path for the incomplete download folder.
longDescription: Specifies the directory path where Transmission should store incomplete downloads. Requires `UseIncompleteDownloadFolder` to be true.

title: Set Default Download Location
description: Use a fixed location for completed downloads.
longDescription: Configures Transmission to always save completed downloads to a specific, constant location (typically `~/Downloads`).

acceptedParameterValues.description: Prompt for download location (or use last used).

title: Disable Download Confirmation Prompt
description: Don‚Äôt prompt for confirmation before downloading.
longDescription: Prevents Transmission from asking for confirmation before starting a new torrent download.

title: Disable Magnet Link Confirmation Prompt
description: Don‚Äôt prompt for confirmation when opening magnet links.
longDescription: Prevents Transmission from asking for confirmation when a magnet link is opened.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not prompt for magnet links.

title: Confirm Removal of Non-Downloading Transfers
description: Prompt for confirmation before removing non-downloading active transfers.
longDescription: If set to true, Transmission will ask for confirmation before removing active transfers that are not currently downloading (e.g., seeding or stalled).

title: Trash Original Torrent Files
description: Trash original .torrent files after they are added.
longDescription: Automatically moves the original .torrent file to the Trash after it has been successfully added to Transmission.

title: Hide Donate Message
description: Hide the donate message in Transmission.
longDescription: Prevents the occasional message prompting for donations from appearing in Transmission.

title: Hide Legal Disclaimer
description: Hide the legal disclaimer in Transmission.
longDescription: Prevents the legal disclaimer message from appearing in Transmission.

title: Randomize Port on Launch
description: Randomize port on each launch of Transmission.
longDescription: Configures Transmission to use a different random port for incoming connections each time it starts, which can help bypass some network restrictions or improve privacy.

title: Auto-Play Videos
description: Auto-play videos when opened with QuickTime Player.
longDescription: Makes QuickTime Player automatically start playing video files as soon as they are opened.

title: Enable Debug Menu in Disk Utility
description: Enable the debug menu in Disk Utility.
longDescription: Adds a hidden 'Debug' menu to Disk Utility, providing access to advanced options and diagnostic tools.

title: Enable Advanced Image Options in Disk Utility
description: Enable advanced image options in Disk Utility.
longDescription: Unlocks additional, advanced options when creating or modifying disk images in Disk Utility.

title: Enable Debug Menu in Contacts/Address Book
description: Enable the debug menu in Contacts (Address Book).
longDescription: Adds a hidden 'Debug' menu to the Contacts (formerly Address Book) application, providing access to internal options and diagnostics.

title: Enable Dashboard Dev Mode
description: Enable Dashboard dev mode (allows keeping widgets on the desktop).
longDescription: Activates a developer mode for Dashboard that allows widgets to be detached from the Dashboard layer and placed directly onto the desktop. Dashboard is deprecated in modern macOS.
notes: Dashboard is deprecated/removed in macOS Catalina and later.

title: Enable Debug Menu in Calendar/iCal
description: Enable the debug menu in Calendar (iCal).
longDescription: Adds a hidden 'Debug' menu to the Calendar (formerly iCal) application, providing access to internal options and diagnostics. This setting is for pre-macOS 10.8 versions.
notes: This setting is primarily for iCal on macOS versions before 10.8 (Mountain Lion).

title: Disable Send and Reply Animations
description: Disable send and reply animations in Mail.app.
longDescription: Turns off the visual animations that occur when sending or replying to emails in the Mail application.
notes: Also set `DisableSendAnimations` to true for send animations.

title: Copy Email Addresses as Plain Address
description: Copy email addresses as `foo@example.com` instead of `Foo Bar <foo@example.com>` in Mail.app.
longDescription: Changes the format when copying email addresses from Mail.app to paste only the email address itself, rather than the name and email address.

title: Add Send Shortcut (Cmd+Enter)
description: Add the keyboard shortcut ‚åò + Enter to send an email in Mail.app.
longDescription: Assigns Command+Enter as a keyboard shortcut to send the current email message in Mail.app.
notes: Command: `defaults write com.apple.mail NSUserKeyEquivalents -dict-add "Send" "@\U21a9"`

title: Enable Threaded Mode and Sort Order for Drafts
description: Display emails in threaded mode, sorted by date (oldest at the top) in Drafts.
longDescription: Configures the Drafts folder in Mail.app to display emails in threaded conversations, sorted by date with the oldest messages appearing at the top.
notes: This involves multiple dictionary additions: `DisplayInThreadedMode` to `yes`, `SortedDescending` to `yes` (for oldest at top, might be counterintuitive based on name), and `SortOrder` to `received-date`.

title: Disable Inline Attachment Viewing
description: Disable inline attachments (just show the icons) in Mail.app.
longDescription: Prevents Mail.app from displaying image attachments and other media inline within the email body, showing icons instead.

title: Disable Automatic Spell Checking in Mail
description: Disable automatic spell checking in Mail.app.
longDescription: Turns off Mail.app's automatic spell checking feature while composing emails.

title: Disable Smooth Scrolling
description: Disable smooth scrolling animation for a more direct feel.
longDescription: Disables the smooth scrolling animation effect system-wide. Some users prefer this for a more immediate scrolling response, especially on older Macs or with specific peripherals.
notes: May require logout or app restart to take full effect.

title: Disable Notification Center
description: Disable Notification Center and remove the menu bar icon.
longDescription: Unloads the Notification Center UI process, effectively disabling notifications and removing its icon from the menu bar. This is a significant system modification and may affect features relying on Notification Center.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Disable Notification Center. Use with: `launchctl unload -w /System/Library/LaunchAgents/com.apple.notificationcenterui.plist`
Enable Notification Center. Use with: `launchctl load -w /System/Library/LaunchAgents/com.apple.notificationcenterui.plist`

notes: To re-enable, use `launchctl load -w /System/Library/LaunchAgents/com.apple.notificationcenterui.plist`. This command directly modifies system services.

title: Show Item Info in Icon Views
description: Show item information (e.g., file size, dimensions) below/next to icons on the desktop and in other icon views.
longDescription: Configures Finder's icon views (including the Desktop) to display additional information about items, such as image dimensions for pictures or item counts for folders. This affects DesktopViewSettings:IconViewSettings, FK_StandardViewSettings:IconViewSettings, and StandardViewSettings:IconViewSettings.
notes: This is typically managed via PlistBuddy. E.g., `/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c "Set :DesktopViewSettings:IconViewSettings:showItemInfo true" ~/Library/Preferences/com.apple.finder.plist`. Similar commands apply to FK_StandardViewSettings and StandardViewSettings.

title: Item Info Label Position on Desktop
description: Show item info to the right of icons on the desktop instead of below.
longDescription: When item info is shown for icons on the Desktop, this setting positions the label to the right of the icon instead of below it.
notes: Managed via PlistBuddy: `/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c "Set DesktopViewSettings:IconViewSettings:labelOnBottom false" ~/Library/Preferences/com.apple.finder.plist`.

title: Enable Snap-to-Grid for Icons
description: Enable snap-to-grid for icons on the desktop and in other icon views.
longDescription: Configures Finder's icon views (including the Desktop) to snap icons to an invisible grid, helping with alignment. This affects DesktopViewSettings:IconViewSettings, FK_StandardViewSettings:IconViewSettings, and StandardViewSettings:IconViewSettings.
notes: Managed via PlistBuddy. E.g., `/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c "Set :DesktopViewSettings:IconViewSettings:arrangeBy grid" ~/Library/Preferences/com.apple.finder.plist`. Similar commands apply to FK_StandardViewSettings and StandardViewSettings.

title: Grid Spacing for Icons
description: Set grid spacing for icons on the desktop and in other icon views.
longDescription: Adjusts the spacing (in pixels) of the invisible grid to which icons snap in Finder's icon views (including the Desktop). This affects DesktopViewSettings:IconViewSettings, FK_StandardViewSettings:IconViewSettings, and StandardViewSettings:IconViewSettings.
notes: Managed via PlistBuddy. E.g., `/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c "Set :DesktopViewSettings:IconViewSettings:gridSpacing 100" ~/Library/Preferences/com.apple.finder.plist`. Similar commands apply to FK_StandardViewSettings and StandardViewSettings. Default is usually around 60-70.

title: Icon Size in Icon Views
description: Set the size of icons on the desktop and in other icon views.
longDescription: Sets the default size (in pixels) for icons in Finder's icon views, including the Desktop. This affects DesktopViewSettings:IconViewSettings, FK_StandardViewSettings:IconViewSettings, and StandardViewSettings:IconViewSettings.
notes: Managed via PlistBuddy. E.g., `/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c "Set :DesktopViewSettings:IconViewSettings:iconSize 56" ~/Library/Preferences/com.apple.finder.plist`. Similar commands apply to FK_StandardViewSettings and StandardViewSettings. Common default is 64.

title: Show User Library Folder
description: Make the ~/Library folder visible in Finder.
longDescription: The user's Library folder (Àú/Library) is hidden by default. This command makes it visible in Finder by changing its flags.
notes: The script also runs `xattr -d com.apple.FinderInfo ~/Library`.

title: Show /Volumes Folder
description: Make the /Volumes folder visible in Finder.
longDescription: The /Volumes folder, which contains mount points for connected drives and disk images, is hidden by default in the Finder's Go To Folder. This command makes it visible.

title: Add Spacer to Dock (Right Side)
description: Add a flexible spacer item to the right side of the Dock (where Trash and Stacks are).
longDescription: Inserts an invisible, flexible spacer tile into the 'persistent-others' section of the Dock, allowing for custom grouping of items like Stacks and the Trash.
notes: This is achieved by adding a specific dictionary to the `persistent-others` array: `defaults write com.apple.dock persistent-others -array-add '{tile-data={}; tile-type="spacer-tile";}'`

title: Add Spacer to Dock (Left Side)
description: Add a flexible spacer item to the left side of the Dock (where applications are).
longDescription: Inserts an invisible, flexible spacer tile into the 'persistent-apps' section of the Dock, allowing for custom grouping of application icons.
notes: This is achieved by adding a specific dictionary to the `persistent-apps` array: `defaults write com.apple.dock persistent-apps -array-add '{tile-data={}; tile-type="spacer-tile";}'`

title: Disable Local Time Machine Backups (Snapshots)
description: Disable local Time Machine snapshots on portable Macs.
longDescription: Prevents Time Machine from creating local snapshots on the startup disk when the main backup drive is unavailable. This can save disk space. Note: This feature and its management have changed in newer macOS versions; local snapshots are now more integral.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Disable local snapshots. Command: `sudo tmutil disablelocal`
Enable local snapshots. Command: `sudo tmutil enablelocal`

notes: This command might be less relevant or behave differently on modern macOS versions where APFS snapshots are heavily used.

title: Custom Login Window Message
description: Display a custom message on the login window.
longDescription: Sets a text message that appears on the macOS login screen. The script example dynamically generates this message with hostname, model, OS version, CPU, and RAM information.
notes: The script provides an example of dynamically creating the string value.

title: Disable Firefox Crash Reporter Submission
description: Prevent Firefox from automatically submitting crash reports.
longDescription: Configures Mozilla Firefox to not automatically submit crash reports to Mozilla.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Submit crash reports automatically (Firefox default might vary).

title: Rectangle - Use Alternate Default Shortcuts
description: Use Rectangle's alternate set of default keyboard shortcuts for window management.
longDescription: Configures the Rectangle window management application to use its alternate set of default keyboard shortcuts.

title: Rectangle - Subsequent Execution Mode
description: Configure how Rectangle behaves on subsequent executions of the same shortcut.
longDescription: Defines the behavior when a Rectangle window management shortcut is triggered multiple times on the same window. A value of 0 typically means cycling through predefined sizes/positions for that specific action (e.g., half, two-thirds, one-third).

acceptedParameterValues.description: Cycle through related sizes/positions (default for many actions).

title: Zoom - Disable Dual Monitor Mode for Shared Screen/Participants
description: Don't show shared screens and participants window on separate monitors in Zoom.
longDescription: Prevents Zoom from automatically using a second monitor to display participant videos or shared content separately when dual monitors are active.
notes: Although the value is 'true'/'false', it's written as a string.

title: Zoom - Always Show Usernames on Videos
description: Always display participant names on their video feeds in Zoom.
longDescription: Configures Zoom to persistently show the names of participants overlaid on their video.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Show usernames on hover or as needed.

notes: Although the value is 'true'/'false', it's written as a string.

title: Zoom - Go Fullscreen on Shared Screen (Dual Monitor)
description: Automatically go fullscreen when a screen is shared, specifically if dual monitors are set up.
longDescription: When screen sharing starts and dual monitors are configured, Zoom will enter fullscreen mode on the monitor displaying the shared content.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enter fullscreen on shared screen with dual monitors.

notes: Although the value is 'true'/'false', it's written as a string.

title: Zoom - Scale Shared Screen to Fit Window
description: When viewing a shared screen, scale it to fit your window rather than maximizing the window.
longDescription: When someone shares their screen, Zoom will scale the shared content to fit your current window size, instead of automatically maximizing or resizing your window to match the shared screen's aspect ratio or resolution.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Scale shared screen to fit current window.

notes: Although the value is 'true'/'false', it's written as a string.

title: Zoom - Don't Use Split View for Shared Screen/Participants
description: Avoid automatically splitting the view between the shared screen and the participants window.
longDescription: Prevents Zoom from using a side-by-side (split) view for shared content and the participant video panel, typically showing participants as floating windows instead.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Use split view for shared screen and participants.
Do not use split view (e.g., use floating windows for participants).

notes: Although the value is 'true'/'false', it's written as a string.

title: Zoom - Don't Show Menu Bar Icon
description: Prevent Zoom from adding its icon to the macOS menu bar.
longDescription: Hides the Zoom application's persistent icon in the system menu bar, reducing menu bar clutter.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Show Zoom icon in menu bar.
Hide Zoom icon from menu bar.

notes: Although the value is 'true'/'false', it's written as a string.

title: GPGMail - Disable Default Email Signing
description: Disable signing emails by default in GPGMail for Mail.app.
longDescription: Configures GPGMail (a Mail.app plugin for GPG encryption and signing) to not automatically sign new emails. Signing can still be enabled manually on a per-email basis.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not sign new emails by default.

title: Opera - Expand Print Dialog by Default
description: Expand the system print dialog by default in Opera.
longDescription: When using the system print dialog in the Opera web browser, this setting ensures it opens in its expanded state, showing all available printing options, rather than the compact view.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Use compact print dialog by default.

notes: The script uses `-boolean true`, which is equivalent to `-bool true` for `defaults`.

title: SizeUp - Start at Login
description: Configure SizeUp window manager to start automatically at login.
longDescription: Adds the SizeUp.app window management utility to the list of login items, causing it to launch automatically every time the user logs in.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not start SizeUp at login.

title: SizeUp - Don't Show Preferences on Next Start
description: Prevent SizeUp from showing its preferences window automatically on the next launch.
longDescription: Disables the behavior where SizeUp might display its preferences window when it is next started, for example, after its first installation or an update.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Show preferences window on next start.
Do not show preferences window on next start.

title: Twitter.app - Disable Smart Quotes
description: Disable smart quotes in Twitter.app, useful for code tweets.
