longDescription: Prevents the official Twitter for Mac application from automatically converting straight quotation marks (`"` and `'`) into curly (typographical) quotes. This is particularly useful when tweeting code snippets or technical text.

title: Twitter.app - Menu Bar Icon Behavior
description: Show the app window when clicking the menu bar icon for Twitter.app.
longDescription: Configures the Twitter.app menu bar icon so that clicking it opens the main application window directly, instead of potentially showing a menu or other default behavior.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Show app window on menu bar icon click.
Default menu bar icon behavior (e.g., show menu).

title: Twitter.app - Enable Develop Menu
description: Enable the hidden ‚ÄòDevelop‚Äô menu in Twitter.app.
longDescription: Adds a 'Develop' menu to the Twitter for Mac application's menu bar, providing access to debugging tools, internal settings, and experimental features.

title: Twitter.app - Open Links in Background
description: Open links clicked in Twitter.app in the background.
longDescription: When a link is clicked within the Twitter for Mac application, this setting makes the link open in the default web browser in a background tab or window, rather than bringing the browser to the foreground immediately.

title: Twitter.app - Allow Esc to Close Compose Window
description: Allow closing the ‚Äònew tweet‚Äô compose window by pressing the Esc key in Twitter.app.
longDescription: Enables the Escape (Esc) key to close the new tweet composition window in the Twitter for Mac application, providing a quick way to dismiss it.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Esc key does not close compose window (default behavior).

title: Twitter.app - Show Full Names
description: Show full names rather than Twitter handles in Twitter.app.
longDescription: Configures the Twitter for Mac application to display users' full display names in timelines and profiles, instead of or in addition to their Twitter handles (@username).

acceptedParameterValues.description: Show Twitter handles (default behavior might vary).

title: Twitter.app - Hide in Background
description: Hide the Twitter.app in the background if it‚Äôs not the front-most window.
longDescription: If enabled, the Twitter for Mac application will automatically hide itself (its windows will disappear, but the app remains running) when it is not the active (front-most) application.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not hide Twitter.app when in background (default behavior).

title: Tweetbot - Open URLs Directly (Bypass t.co)
description: Bypass Twitter's t.co URL shortener when opening links from Tweetbot.
longDescription: Configures the Tweetbot for Mac application to attempt to resolve and open the original URL directly when a link is clicked, bypassing Twitter's t.co link shortener and redirect service.

title: Show ASCII Control Characters
description: Display ASCII control characters using caret notation in standard text views.
longDescription: Configures standard text views to render ASCII control characters (e.g., null byte) using caret notation (like ^@) instead of them being invisible or causing layout issues. Requires app restart.

title: Trackpad Bottom Right Corner Secondary Click
description: Map the bottom right corner of the trackpad to a secondary click (right-click).
longDescription: Configures the trackpad to perform a secondary click when the bottom right corner is pressed. Value 2 typically corresponds to 'Bottom Right Corner'. Requires logout.
notes: For full effect, also consider `com.apple.driver.AppleBluetoothMultitouch.trackpad TrackpadRightClick -bool true`, `-currentHost NSGlobalDomain com.apple.trackpad.trackpadCornerClickBehavior -int 1`, and `-currentHost NSGlobalDomain com.apple.trackpad.enableSecondaryClick -bool true`.

title: Trackpad Right Click Enable
description: Enable right click functionality on the trackpad, often used with corner click.
longDescription: Works in conjunction with settings like TrackpadCornerSecondaryClick to enable physical right-click behavior. Requires logout.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable physical right click (if corner click is set).

title: Trackpad Corner Click Behavior (Current Host)
description: Set trackpad corner click behavior for the current user.
longDescription: Configures the behavior when a corner of the trackpad is clicked (e.g., for secondary click). Requires logout.

title: Enable Secondary Click (Current Host)
description: Enable secondary click (right-click) for the current user.
longDescription: Globally enables secondary click functionality for the current user. Often paired with specific trackpad settings for how to invoke it (e.g., two-finger click, corner click). Requires logout.

title: Disable Natural Scrolling Direction
description: Disable 'natural' (Lion-style) scrolling, so content moves with finger direction.
longDescription: Reverses the scrolling direction. When false, content moves in the same direction as finger movement on the trackpad or scroll wheel (traditional scrolling). When true (default), content moves opposite to finger movement ('natural'). Requires logout or app restart.

title: Key Repeat Rate
description: Set the keyboard key repeat rate.
longDescription: Adjusts how quickly a character repeats when a key is held down. Lower values mean faster repeat. Requires `ApplePressAndHoldEnabled` to be `false`. Requires logout.
notes: A value of 1 is very fast. Default is typically 2 (30ms). This setting corresponds to System Settings -> Keyboard -> Key repeat rate.

title: Initial Key Repeat Delay
description: Set the delay before key repeat begins.
longDescription: Adjusts the delay before a character starts repeating when a key is held down. Lower values mean a shorter delay. Requires `ApplePressAndHoldEnabled` to be `false`. Requires logout.
notes: A value of 10 is very short (150ms). Default is typically 15 (225ms). This setting corresponds to System Settings -> Keyboard -> Delay until repeat.

title: Preferred Languages
description: Set the preferred order of languages for the system.
longDescription: Defines the user's preferred languages, in order of preference. This affects UI language, date/time formats if locale isn't explicitly set, etc. Requires logout or restart.
notes: Example: `defaults write NSGlobalDomain AppleLanguages -array "en-US" "nl-US"`

title: System Locale
description: Set the system locale for formatting dates, times, numbers, and currency.
longDescription: Defines the regional settings used for formatting. Can include currency overrides. Example: `en_US@currency=EUR`. Requires logout or restart.

title: Measurement Units
description: Set the preferred measurement units (e.g., Centimeters, Inches).
longDescription: Determines whether the system uses Metric or Imperial units for measurements. Requires logout or restart.

title: Use Metric Units
description: Explicitly set whether to use metric units.
longDescription: A boolean flag that works in conjunction with AppleMeasurementUnits to control unit systems. True for metric. Requires logout or restart.

title: Show Input Menu in Login Window
description: Show the language/input menu in the top right corner of the login screen.
longDescription: Allows users to select their keyboard input source from the login window before logging in. Requires restart.

title: Disable All Finder Animations
description: Disable window animations and Get Info animations in Finder.
longDescription: Turns off various animations within Finder, such as window opening/closing and Get Info panel transitions, which can make Finder feel more responsive. Requires Finder restart.

title: Default New Window Target
description: Set the default location for new Finder windows (e.g., Desktop, Home).
longDescription: Configures what location new Finder windows open to by default. Requires Finder restart.
notes: If using `PfLo`, `NewWindowTargetPath` must also be set, e.g., `file://${HOME}/Documents/`.

title: Default New Window Path
description: Set the specific path for new Finder windows if NewWindowTarget is PfLo.
longDescription: Specifies the exact file URL path for new Finder windows when `NewWindowTarget` is set to `PfLo`. Requires Finder restart.
notes: Example: `file://${HOME}/Desktop/`

title: Show Status Bar
description: Show the status bar at the bottom of Finder windows.
longDescription: Displays the status bar in Finder windows, which shows information like the number of items in a folder and the available disk space. Requires Finder restart.

title: Show Full POSIX Path in Title
description: Display the full POSIX path as the Finder window title.
longDescription: Makes the Finder window's title bar show the complete POSIX path of the current folder instead of just the folder's name. Requires Finder restart.

title: Enable Spring Loading for Directories
description: Enable the spring loading feature for directories system-wide.
longDescription: When dragging an item over a folder, this feature causes the folder to automatically open after a short delay, allowing navigation into subfolders during a drag operation. Requires Finder restart or logout.

title: Spring Loading Delay
description: Adjust the delay before a folder springs open during drag operations.
longDescription: Sets the delay (in seconds) before a folder opens when an item is hovered over it during a drag. A value of 0 makes it nearly instant. Requires Finder restart or logout.

title: Disable .DS_Store File Creation on Network Volumes
description: Prevent Finder from creating .DS_Store files on network shares.
longDescription: .DS_Store files store custom folder attributes like icon positions and view settings. This option disables their creation on network volumes. Requires Finder restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not write .DS_Store on network volumes.

title: Disable .DS_Store File Creation on USB Volumes
description: Prevent Finder from creating .DS_Store files on USB drives.
longDescription: This option disables the creation of .DS_Store files on USB storage devices. Requires Finder restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not write .DS_Store on USB volumes.

title: Skip Disk Image Verification
description: Disable the verification process when mounting disk images.
longDescription: Prevents macOS from verifying disk images (.dmg files) when they are mounted. This can speed up the mounting process but bypasses a potential integrity check. Requires app restart (Disk Utility or related services).

title: Skip Locked Disk Image Verification
description: Disable verification for locked disk images.
longDescription: Specifically skips the verification process for locked disk images. Requires app restart.

title: Skip Remote Disk Image Verification
description: Disable verification for disk images mounted from remote locations.
longDescription: Specifically skips the verification process for disk images mounted from network or remote sources. Requires app restart.

title: Auto-open Read-only Mounted Volumes
description: Automatically open a new Finder window when a read-only volume is mounted.
longDescription: When a read-only disk image or volume (like a CD/DVD or some .dmg files) is mounted, Finder will automatically open a window showing its contents. Requires Finder restart.

title: Auto-open Read-Write Mounted Volumes
description: Automatically open a new Finder window when a read-write volume is mounted.
longDescription: When a writable disk image or volume is mounted, Finder will automatically open a window showing its contents. Requires Finder restart.

title: Auto-open New Removable Disks
description: Automatically open a new Finder window when a new removable disk is connected.
longDescription: When a removable storage device (like a USB flash drive) is connected, Finder will automatically open a window displaying its content. Requires Finder restart.

title: Disable Warning Before Emptying Trash
description: Disable the confirmation warning before emptying the Trash.
longDescription: Prevents Finder from showing a confirmation dialog asking 'Are you sure you want to permanently erase the items in the Trash?'. Requires Finder restart.

title: Enable AirDrop Over All Interfaces
description: Allow AirDrop to work over Ethernet and on potentially unsupported Macs.
longDescription: Configures AirDrop to attempt to operate over all available network interfaces, not just Wi-Fi. This might enable AirDrop on Macs connected via Ethernet or on older, officially unsupported models. Requires Finder restart.

title: Highlight Hover Effect for Stacks
description: Enable a highlight hover effect for items in a Dock stack when viewed in grid mode.
longDescription: When a Dock stack is opened in grid view, hovering the mouse over an item will cause it to be highlighted. Requires Dock restart.

title: Minimize Windows to Application Icon
description: Minimize windows into their application‚Äôs icon in the Dock instead of to a new Dock tile.
longDescription: When this is enabled, minimizing a window causes it to be visually absorbed into its application's icon in the Dock, rather than creating a separate preview tile for the minimized window. Requires Dock restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Minimize to a new tile in Dock (default).

title: Show Indicator Lights for Open Applications
description: Display a small dot beneath open applications in the Dock.
longDescription: Shows a small indicator light (dot) below the icon of any application that is currently running. Requires Dock restart.

title: Clear Persistent App Icons
description: Remove all pinned application icons from the Dock.
longDescription: This command clears all application icons that are persistently pinned to the Dock, leaving only running applications (if `static-only` is false) or an empty application section. Useful for a clean setup. Requires Dock restart.
notes: To clear, set to an empty array: `defaults write com.apple.dock persistent-apps -array`

title: Disable Application Launch Animation
description: Don‚Äôt animate opening applications from the Dock.
longDescription: Disables the bouncing animation that normally occurs when an application is launched from the Dock. Requires Dock restart.

title: Mission Control Animation Duration
description: Adjust the speed of Mission Control animations.
longDescription: Sets the duration for animations within Mission Control (e.g., when showing all windows). A lower value (e.g., 0.1) makes animations faster. Requires Dock restart.

title: Disable Window Grouping by App in Mission Control (Old Expos√© Behavior)
description: Don‚Äôt group windows by application in Mission Control; use the old Expos√© behavior instead.
longDescription: When set to false, Mission Control displays all open windows individually, similar to the older Expos√© feature, rather than grouping them by application. Requires Dock restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Group windows by application (default in modern macOS).
Do not group windows by application (classic Expos√© behavior).

notes: Note: `yannbertrand-macos-defaults` documents `expose-group-apps`. This key `expose-group-by-app` provides the inverse behavior if that's desired.

title: Disable Dashboard
description: Disable the Dashboard feature.
longDescription: Turns off Dashboard, which hosts widgets. Dashboard is deprecated in modern macOS. Requires Dock restart.
notes: Dashboard was removed in macOS Catalina (10.15).

title: Don‚Äôt Show Dashboard as a Space
description: Prevent Dashboard from appearing as a separate Space in Mission Control.
longDescription: If Dashboard is enabled, this setting prevents it from occupying its own Space, making it accessible as an overlay instead. Requires Dock restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Dashboard as a Space (default on older systems where Dashboard was a Space).

notes: Relevant for macOS versions where Dashboard could be a Space.

title: Make Hidden App Icons Translucent
description: Render Dock icons of hidden applications as translucent.
longDescription: When an application is hidden (e.g., via Command-H), its icon in the Dock will appear semi-transparent. Requires Dock restart.

title: Disable Launchpad Gesture
description: Disable the pinch gesture (thumb and three fingers) for opening Launchpad.
longDescription: Turns off the trackpad gesture that opens Launchpad. Requires Dock restart.

title: Hot Corner Action (Top Left)
description: Set the action for the top-left screen hot corner.
longDescription: Configures the function triggered when the mouse cursor is moved to the top-left corner of the screen. Requires Dock restart.
notes: Use with `wvous-tl-modifier` for modifier keys (0 for none).

title: Hot Corner Modifier (Top Left)
description: Set the modifier key for the top-left screen hot corner.
longDescription: Defines a modifier key (Shift, Control, Option, Command) that must be held while moving the cursor to the top-left hot corner to trigger its action. Requires Dock restart.

title: Hot Corner Action (Top Right)
description: Set the action for the top-right screen hot corner.
longDescription: Configures the function triggered when the mouse cursor is moved to the top-right corner of the screen. Requires Dock restart.
notes: Use with `wvous-tr-modifier` for modifier keys.

title: Hot Corner Modifier (Top Right)
description: Set the modifier key for the top-right screen hot corner.
longDescription: Defines a modifier key that must be held while moving the cursor to the top-right hot corner to trigger its action. Requires Dock restart.

title: Hot Corner Action (Bottom Left)
description: Set the action for the bottom-left screen hot corner.
longDescription: Configures the function triggered when the mouse cursor is moved to the bottom-left corner of the screen. Requires Dock restart.
notes: Use with `wvous-bl-modifier` for modifier keys.

title: Hot Corner Modifier (Bottom Left)
description: Set the modifier key for the bottom-left screen hot corner.
longDescription: Defines a modifier key that must be held while moving the cursor to the bottom-left hot corner to trigger its action. Requires Dock restart.

title: Hot Corner Action (Bottom Right)
description: Set the action for the bottom-right screen hot corner.
longDescription: Configures the function triggered when the mouse cursor is moved to the bottom-right corner of the screen. Requires Dock restart.
notes: Use with `wvous-br-modifier` for modifier keys.

title: Hot Corner Modifier (Bottom Right)
description: Set the modifier key for the bottom-right screen hot corner.
longDescription: Defines a modifier key that must be held while moving the cursor to the bottom-right hot corner to trigger its action. Requires Dock restart.

title: Disable Universal Search (Suggestions to Apple)
description: Prevent Safari from sending search queries to Apple for Universal Search suggestions.
longDescription: Turns off Safari's Universal Search feature, which sends search queries to Apple to provide suggestions. This enhances privacy. Requires Safari restart.
notes: Pair with `SuppressSearchSuggestions -bool true` for more comprehensive suggestion disabling.

title: Suppress Search Suggestions
description: Prevent Safari from showing search suggestions as you type.
longDescription: Disables the display of search engine suggestions in Safari's Smart Search Field as you type your query. Requires Safari restart.

title: Enable Tab Key to Highlight All Web Page Items
description: Allow the Tab key to navigate through all interactive elements on a webpage.
longDescription: Expands the Tab key's functionality in Safari to cycle focus through all links, buttons, and form fields on a webpage, rather than just form fields. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Tab highlights text fields and lists only (default).

notes: For complete effect, also set `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2TabsToLinks -bool true`.

title: Enable Tab Key to Highlight All Web Page Items (ContentPageGroup)
description: Secondary setting for Tab key navigation to highlight all items on a webpage.
longDescription: This setting, related to WebKit's content page groups, also contributes to enabling Tab key navigation for all interactive elements. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Tab highlights text fields and lists only (default).

notes: Use in conjunction with `WebKitTabToLinksPreferenceKey`.

title: Set Safari Home Page
description: Define the webpage Safari loads as its home page.
longDescription: Sets the URL that Safari will load when the home page is accessed (e.g., via the home button or new window/tab settings). `about:blank` is often used for faster loading. Requires Safari restart.

title: Disable Auto-Opening of 'Safe' Downloads
description: Prevent Safari from automatically opening files deemed 'safe' after download.
longDescription: Safari has a feature to automatically open certain downloaded files (like images, PDFs, text files) it considers safe. This setting disables that behavior. Requires Safari restart.

title: Enable Backspace Key for Back Navigation
description: Allow the Backspace key to navigate to the previous page in Safari.
longDescription: Enables using the Backspace key (Delete key on some keyboards) to go back in Safari's browsing history. Requires Safari restart.

title: Hide Safari Favorites Bar by Default
description: Set Safari's Favorites Bar (bookmarks bar) to be hidden by default.
longDescription: Configures Safari to not show the Favorites Bar by default when new windows are opened. It can still be toggled manually. Requires Safari restart.

title: Hide Sidebar in Safari Top Sites
description: Prevent the sidebar from showing in Safari's Top Sites view.
longDescription: When viewing Top Sites in Safari, this setting ensures the sidebar (which might display Reading List or Bookmarks) is hidden. Requires Safari restart.

title: Disable Safari Snapshot Update Policy
description: Disable Safari's thumbnail cache for History and Top Sites.
longDescription: This setting controls how Safari updates the thumbnail snapshots it uses for browsing history and Top Sites. Setting it to 2 disables these snapshot updates. Requires Safari restart.

title: Enable Safari Internal Debug Menu
description: Show Safari's internal debug menu for advanced options.
longDescription: Activates a hidden 'Debug' menu in Safari's menu bar, providing access to various internal settings, experimental features, and diagnostic tools. Requires Safari restart.

title: Safari Find on Page: Default to 'Contains'
description: Change Safari's 'Find on Page' (Cmd+F) to default to searching for text that 'Contains' the query, not just 'Starts With'.
longDescription: Modifies the behavior of Safari's in-page search. When false, searches match any occurrence of the text. When true (default), it only matches text starting with the query. Requires Safari restart.

title: Clear Safari Proxies in Bookmarks Bar
description: Remove any predefined proxy icons or special items from Safari‚Äôs bookmarks bar.
longDescription: Sets the `ProxiesInBookmarksBar` key to an empty array `"()"`, effectively clearing out default or system-added special items from the Favorites Bar. Requires Safari restart.

title: Enable Safari Develop Menu
description: Show the Develop menu in Safari's menu bar.
longDescription: Activates the 'Develop' menu in Safari, which provides tools for web developers, including Web Inspector, responsive design mode, and cache management. Requires Safari restart.

title: Enable WebKit Developer Extras Preference
description: Enable WebKit developer extras, often linked with the Develop menu.
longDescription: This is a key preference for enabling advanced web development features within Safari and WebKit views. Requires Safari restart.

title: Enable WebKit Developer Extras (ContentPageGroup)
description: Enable WebKit developer extras for Safari's content page groups.
longDescription: Another key related to enabling developer tools within Safari's web content rendering process. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable developer extras for content pages.
Disable developer extras for content pages (default).

title: Enable WebKit Developer Extras Globally
description: Add a context menu item for showing the Web Inspector in web views across applications.
longDescription: Enables a 'Inspect Element' option in the context menu for WebKit-based views in many applications, not just Safari. Requires app restart for affected applications.

title: Enable Continuous Spell Checking in Safari
description: Turn on Safari's continuous spell checking feature.
longDescription: Safari will check spelling as you type in web forms and text areas if this is enabled. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Disable continuous spell checking (default is often false).

title: Disable Automatic Spelling Correction in Safari
description: Prevent Safari from automatically correcting spelling errors.
longDescription: Turns off Safari's automatic correction of misspelled words while typing in web content. Requires Safari restart.

title: Disable AutoFill from Address Book (Contacts)
description: Stop Safari from automatically filling web forms using information from your Contacts.
longDescription: Prevents Safari from using your contact card and other contacts in your Address Book to automatically fill in fields on web forms like name, address, email, etc. Requires Safari restart.

title: Disable AutoFill for Passwords
description: Prevent Safari from automatically filling in saved passwords on websites.
longDescription: Turns off Safari's feature that automatically populates username and password fields on websites with your saved Keychain credentials. Requires Safari restart.

title: Disable AutoFill for Credit Card Data
description: Stop Safari from automatically filling in saved credit card details on web forms.
longDescription: Prevents Safari from automatically populating credit card number, expiry date, and CVC fields on payment forms with your saved payment information. Requires Safari restart.

title: Disable AutoFill for Miscellaneous Forms
description: Prevent Safari from automatically filling in other types of form data.
longDescription: Disables Safari's AutoFill feature for general form fields that don't fall under contacts, passwords, or credit cards. Requires Safari restart.

title: Enable Fraudulent Website Warnings
description: Ensure Safari warns about potentially fraudulent or phishing websites.
longDescription: Activates Safari's built-in Safe Browsing feature, which checks websites against lists of known phishing and malware sites and displays a warning if a site is deemed unsafe. Requires Safari restart.

title: Disable WebKit Plugins
description: Disable support for legacy WebKit plugins in Safari.
longDescription: Turns off support for older browser plugins like Flash Player or Silverlight within Safari. Most modern websites do not require these. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable WebKit plugins (default on older systems).

notes: Also consider `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2PluginsEnabled -bool false`.

title: Disable WebKit Plugins (ContentPageGroup)
description: Secondary setting to disable WebKit plugins for Safari's content page groups.
longDescription: This further ensures that legacy WebKit plugins are disabled within Safari's web content rendering processes. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable plugins for content pages (default on older systems).

notes: Use in conjunction with `WebKitPluginsEnabled`.

title: Disable Java Support in Safari
description: Turn off Java plugin support in Safari.
longDescription: Disables the Java plugin, preventing Java applets from running in Safari. Java in browsers is largely obsolete and a security risk. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable Java (default on very old systems).

notes: Also consider `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2JavaEnabled -bool false` and `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2JavaEnabledForLocalFiles -bool false`.

title: Disable Java Support (ContentPageGroup)
description: Secondary setting to disable Java for Safari's content page groups.
longDescription: Further ensures that the Java plugin is disabled within Safari's web content rendering processes. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable Java for content pages (default on very old systems).

title: Disable Java Support for Local Files (ContentPageGroup)
description: Disable Java for local files in Safari's content page groups.
longDescription: Specifically disables the Java plugin for local HTML files opened in Safari. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable Java for local files (default on very old systems).

title: Block JavaScript Pop-up Windows
description: Prevent websites from opening pop-up windows automatically via JavaScript.
longDescription: Controls Safari's pop-up blocker. When false, JavaScript-initiated pop-up windows are generally blocked. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Allow JavaScript to open windows automatically.
Block JavaScript from opening windows automatically (default behavior is often to block unless user allows).

notes: Also consider `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2JavaScriptCanOpenWindowsAutomatically -bool false`.

title: Block JavaScript Pop-up Windows (ContentPageGroup)
description: Secondary setting to block JavaScript pop-ups for Safari's content page groups.
longDescription: Further ensures that JavaScript-initiated pop-up windows are blocked within Safari's web content rendering processes. Requires Safari restart.

title: Disable Inline Media Playback (Auto-Play)
description: Prevent videos from playing automatically when embedded inline on a webpage.
longDescription: Controls whether videos embedded directly within a webpage (inline) can start playing automatically. Setting to false aims to prevent this. Requires Safari restart.
notes: Behavior can be complex due to website-specific permissions and other related settings like `com.apple.Safari.ContentPageGroupIdentifier.WebKit2AllowsInlineMediaPlayback`.

title: Disable Inline Media Playback (Auto-Play) - Tech Preview
description: Prevent videos from playing automatically inline in Safari Technology Preview.
longDescription: Same as the main Safari setting, but for Safari Technology Preview. Prevents videos embedded directly within a webpage from auto-playing. Requires Safari Technology Preview restart.

title: Disable Inline Media Playback (ContentPageGroup)
description: Secondary setting to disable inline media playback for Safari's content page groups.
longDescription: Further ensures that videos embedded inline do not auto-play within Safari's web content rendering processes. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Allow inline playback for content pages (default).
Disallow inline playback for content pages.

title: Disable Inline Media Playback (ContentPageGroup) - Tech Preview
description: Secondary setting for disabling inline media playback in Safari Technology Preview content page groups.
longDescription: Same as the main Safari setting but for Safari Technology Preview, further ensuring inline videos do not auto-play. Requires Safari Technology Preview restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Allow inline playback for content pages (default).
Disallow inline playback for content pages.

title: Enable 'Do Not Track' HTTP Header
description: Instruct Safari to send the 'Do Not Track' HTTP header with web requests.
longDescription: When enabled, Safari sends a DNT:1 header with HTTP requests, signaling to websites the user's preference against tracking. Website compliance is voluntary. Requires Safari restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Do not send 'Do Not Track' header (default).

title: Automatically Update Safari Extensions
description: Enable automatic updates for installed Safari extensions.
longDescription: Configures Safari to periodically check for and automatically install updates for any installed extensions. Requires Safari restart.

title: Disable Mail Send Animations
description: Turn off the animation when sending an email in Mail.app.
longDescription: Disables the visual animation that occurs when an email is sent from the Mail application. Requires Mail restart.

title: Copy Email Addresses as Address Only
description: When copying email addresses from Mail, copy only the address (e.g., `foo@example.com`) instead of the name and address (e.g., `Foo Bar <foo@example.com>`).
longDescription: Changes the default behavior of Mail.app when copying email addresses. When false, only the email address itself is copied to the clipboard. Requires Mail restart.

title: Add Keyboard Shortcut for Send (Cmd+Enter)
description: Set Command-Enter as a keyboard shortcut to send an email in Mail.app.
longDescription: Customizes Mail.app's keyboard shortcuts to allow sending the current email by pressing Command-Enter. Requires Mail restart.
notes: This is set by adding to a dictionary: `defaults write com.apple.mail NSUserKeyEquivalents -dict-add "Send" "@\U21a9"` (where `@` is Command and `\U21a9` is Enter).

title: Configure Drafts Viewer Attributes
description: Set display mode, sort direction, and sort order for the Drafts folder in Mail.app.
longDescription: Customizes how emails are displayed in the Drafts folder. Example sets threaded mode, sort by received date, oldest at top. Requires Mail restart.
notes: This is a dictionary key. Example for threaded, sort by date (oldest top): `defaults write com.apple.mail DraftsViewerAttributes -dict-add "DisplayInThreadedMode" -string "yes" -dict-add "SortedDescending" -string "yes" -dict-add "SortOrder" -string "received-date"`.

title: Disable Inline Attachment Viewing in Mail
description: Show icons for attachments instead of displaying them inline in Mail.app.
longDescription: Prevents Mail.app from rendering images and other attachments directly within the email body. Instead, attachments will be shown as icons. Requires Mail restart.

title: Disable Spell Checking in Mail
description: Turn off automatic spell checking while composing emails in Mail.app.
longDescription: Disables Mail.app's built-in spell checking feature that operates as you type. Requires Mail restart.

title: Disable Sound for Incoming Mail
description: Turn off the sound notification for new incoming emails.
longDescription: Mutes the sound effect that plays when a new email arrives in Mail.app. Requires Mail restart.

title: Disable Sounds for Other Mail Actions
description: Turn off sounds for various other actions within Mail.app.
longDescription: Disables sound effects for actions in Mail.app other than receiving new mail (e.g., sending mail, errors). Requires Mail restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Play sounds for other mail actions (default).
Disable sounds for other mail actions.

title: Mark All Messages as Read in Conversation View
description: Automatically mark all messages in a conversation as read when the conversation is opened.
longDescription: When viewing emails in conversation mode, opening a conversation will mark all messages within that thread as read. Requires Mail restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Mark all as read when opening conversation.
Do not automatically mark all as read (default).

title: Disable Including Trash in Search Results
description: Prevent Mail search from including results from the Trash folder.
longDescription: When searching in Mail.app, messages in the Trash folder will not be included in the search results. Requires Mail restart.

title: Enable Automatic Mail Fetching
description: Set Mail to automatically check for new messages.
longDescription: Configures Mail.app to automatically fetch new messages from the server, rather than requiring a manual check or a timed interval. Requires Mail restart.
notes: Often used with `PollTime` set to `-1` to indicate 'Automatic' rather than a specific interval.

title: Mail Fetch Poll Time (Automatic)
description: Set Mail's polling interval for new messages to 'Automatic'.
longDescription: Works with `AutoFetch`. Setting `PollTime` to `"-1"` typically means Mail will check for new messages automatically (e.g., using push if available) rather than at a fixed interval. Requires Mail restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Automatic (push or as new messages arrive).

title: Show Most Recent Message at Top in Conversations
description: In conversation view, display the most recent message at the top.
longDescription: When emails are grouped by conversation, this setting ensures that the newest message in the thread appears at the top. Requires Mail restart.

title: Show Week Numbers in Calendar
description: Display week numbers in the Calendar application.
longDescription: Enables the display of week numbers in the weekly and monthly views of the Calendar (iCal) application. Requires Calendar restart.

title: Set First Day of Week to Monday
description: Configure the Calendar application to start the week on Monday.
longDescription: Changes the first day of the week displayed in Calendar views (e.g., week, month) to Monday. Requires Calendar restart.

title: Set Default Window Settings Profile (Pro)
description: Set the 'Pro' theme as the default for new Terminal windows.
longDescription: Configures Terminal.app to use the 'Pro' profile (a dark theme) for any new windows that are opened. Requires Terminal restart.

title: Set Startup Window Settings Profile (Pro)
description: Set the 'Pro' theme for the Terminal window that opens on startup.
longDescription: Configures Terminal.app to use the 'Pro' profile for the initial window that appears when Terminal is first launched. Requires Terminal restart.

title: Disable Audio Feedback for Volume Changes
description: Mute the sound effect played when changing the system volume.
longDescription: Prevents macOS from playing the 'pop' or 'quack' sound when the volume is adjusted using the keyboard volume keys. The domain used in script `com.apple.sound.beep.feedback` is unusual; typically this might be `NSGlobalDomain` with key `com.apple.sound.beep.feedback` or `com.apple.systemsound` with `com.apple.sound.uiaudio.enabled`. Assuming the intent is to disable the UI feedback sound.
notes: If this doesn't work, try `defaults write com.apple.systemsound com.apple.sound.uiaudio.enabled -bool false`

title: Show Battery Percentage
description: Display the battery percentage in the menu bar.
longDescription: Configures the battery status item in the menu bar to show the remaining battery charge as a percentage. Requires SystemUIServer restart.

title: Disable Automatic Window Animations
description: Disable opening and closing window animations system-wide.
longDescription: Turns off the default animations for opening and closing windows across Cocoa applications. Requires app restart.

title: Automatically Illuminate Keyboard in Low Light
description: Enable automatic illumination of the built-in MacBook keyboard in low light conditions.
longDescription: Turns on the feature where the MacBook's keyboard backlight automatically activates when ambient light is low. Requires restart of BezelServices or logout.

title: Keyboard Illumination Timeout
description: Turn off keyboard illumination when the computer is not used for a specified time (in seconds).
longDescription: Sets the inactivity period (in seconds) after which the keyboard backlight will turn off. `300` seconds is 5 minutes. Requires restart of BezelServices or logout.

title: Swipe Between Pages (Three Fingers System-Wide)
description: Enable three-finger swipe to navigate between pages system-wide.
longDescription: Enables the three-finger horizontal swipe gesture on the trackpad for navigating back and forward in applications that support it (like Finder, Safari). Requires logout.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable three-finger swipe for page navigation.
Disable three-finger swipe for page navigation (default is often two-finger).

notes: This is a global setting. Specific applications might have their own overrides. The scripts also set `com.apple.trackpad.threeFingerHorizSwipeGesture` and `com.apple.driver.AppleBluetoothMultitouch.trackpad TrackpadThreeFingerHorizSwipeGesture` to 1.

title: Three Finger Horizontal Swipe Gesture (Current Host)
description: Set three-finger horizontal swipe gesture behavior for the current user (e.g., swipe between pages).
longDescription: Configures the action for a three-finger horizontal swipe on the trackpad. Value 1 often corresponds to 'Swipe between pages'. Requires logout.

title: Three Finger Horizontal Swipe Gesture (Driver)
description: Set three-finger horizontal swipe gesture behavior at the driver level.
longDescription: Low-level configuration for the three-finger horizontal swipe gesture on Bluetooth trackpads. Value 1 often corresponds to 'Swipe between pages'. Requires logout.

title: Enable Text Selection in Quick Look
description: Allow text selection within Quick Look previews.
longDescription: Enables the ability to select and copy text from documents previewed using Quick Look (Space bar). Requires Finder restart.

acceptedParameterValues.description: Enable text selection in Quick Look.
Disable text selection in Quick Look (default).

title: Disable Bouncing Dock Icons
description: Prevent Dock icons from bouncing when an application requires attention or launches.
longDescription: Turns off the bouncing animation for application icons in the Dock, which occurs when an app launches or requests user attention. Requires Dock restart.

title: Dock Magnification
description: Enable or disable Dock icon magnification on hover.
longDescription: Controls whether Dock icons enlarge when the mouse cursor hovers over them. Requires Dock restart.

title: Dock Magnified Icon Size
description: Set the maximum size for magnified Dock icons.
longDescription: Defines how large Dock icons become when magnification is enabled and the cursor hovers over them. Value is in pixels. Requires Dock restart.

title: Trackpad Five Finger Pinch Gesture
description: Configure the five-finger pinch gesture on the trackpad.
longDescription: Sets the action for a five-finger pinch gesture. Value 2 often relates to Launchpad or showing the desktop. Requires logout.

title: Trackpad Four Finger Horizontal Swipe Gesture
description: Configure the four-finger horizontal swipe gesture.
longDescription: Sets the action for a four-finger horizontal swipe. Value 2 often relates to switching between full-screen apps. Requires logout.

title: Trackpad Four Finger Pinch Gesture
description: Configure the four-finger pinch gesture.
longDescription: Sets the action for a four-finger pinch gesture. Value 2 often relates to Launchpad or Mission Control. Requires logout.

title: Trackpad Four Finger Vertical Swipe Gesture
description: Configure the four-finger vertical swipe gesture.
longDescription: Sets the action for a four-finger vertical swipe. Value 2 often relates to Mission Control (swipe up) or App Expos√© (swipe down). Requires logout.

title: Trackpad Hand Resting
description: Enable or disable hand resting detection on the trackpad.
longDescription: This setting relates to palm rejection and how the trackpad handles accidental touches when a hand is resting on it. Value 1 typically enables this detection. Requires logout.

title: Trackpad Horizontal Scroll
description: Enable or disable horizontal scrolling with two fingers.
longDescription: Controls whether two-finger horizontal swipes on the trackpad scroll content horizontally. Requires logout.

title: Trackpad Momentum Scroll
description: Enable or disable momentum (inertial) scrolling.
longDescription: When enabled, scrolling continues for a short period after lifting fingers from the trackpad, giving a sense of momentum. Requires logout.

title: Trackpad Pinch Gesture
description: Enable or disable the pinch-to-zoom gesture.
longDescription: Controls whether the two-finger pinch gesture can be used to zoom in and out in applications that support it. Requires logout.

title: Trackpad Rotate Gesture
description: Enable or disable the two-finger rotate gesture.
longDescription: Controls whether the two-finger rotation gesture can be used in applications that support it (e.g., rotating images). Requires logout.
